title: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
OB: When opening the ImageAnalyzer example, the scrollbars are enabled regardless of the size of the image displayed. This allows the user to scroll even when the image fits within the available space. As a result, unnecessary scrollbars are visible and could potentially confuse the user.
EB: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled when the image fits within the available space. This will prevent unnecessary scrollbars from being displayed and ensure a cleaner user interface experience.
SR:
1. Launch the ImageAnalyzer application.
2. Import an image that fits within the available display area.
3. Observe the behavior of the scrollbars to ensure they are disabled when not required.
